name: WaterWings Seaplane School
about: WaterWings Seaplane School, located at Shelby County Airport (KEET) in Alabama, is a comprehensive flight training facility specializing in single and multi-engine seaplanes, helicopters, tailwheel, spin, and unusual attitude training. Founded by Charles Welden, a seasoned pilot with thousands of hours of seaplane instruction, the school aims to provide a fun, adventurous, and safe learning environment. Our instructors are a mix of young and experienced pilots, and we employ our own FAA-certified mechanics to ensure top-notch aircraft maintenance. We offer a diverse fleet, including Aircams, Huskies, and Super Petrels, all equipped with cutting-edge avionics. With an on-staff designated pilot examiner, checkrides are convenient and hassle-free. Our mission is to deliver exceptional training, respect, and safety, ensuring students leave with new skills, memorable experiences, and a passion for flying. We strive to make every flight a enjoyable and educational experience.
